t: Psalm 116
I Love the Lord
I*pn love the Lord,*s because he has heard my*ld voice and my pleas for mercy.
Because*ln he inclined his ear to me, therefore*ld I will call on him as long as I live.
The*ln snares of death encompassed me; the*ld pangs of Sheol laid hold on me; I*ld suffered distress and anguish.
Then*ln I called on the name of the Lord:*s “O*ld Lord,*s I pray, deliver my soul!”
Gracious*pn is the Lord,*s and righteous; our*ld God is merciful.
The*ln Lord*s preserves the simple; when*ld I was brought low, he saved me.
Return,*ln O my soul, to your rest; for*ld the Lord*s has dealt bountifully with you.
For*pn you have delivered my soul from death, my*ld eyes from tears, my*ld feet from stumbling;
I*ln will walk before the Lord*s in*ld the land of the living.
I*pn believed, even when I spoke: “I*ld am greatly afflicted”;
I*ln said in my alarm, “All*ld mankind are liars.”
What*pn shall I render to the Lord*s for*ld all his benefits to me?
I*ln will lift up the cup of salvation and*ld call on the name of the Lord,*s
I*ln will pay my vows to the Lord*s in*ld the presence of all his people.
Precious*pn in the sight of the Lord*s is*ld the death of his saints.
O*ln Lord,*s I am your servant; I*ld am your servant, the son of your maidservant. You*ld have loosed my bonds.
I*ln will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving and*ld call on the name of the Lord.*s
I*ln will pay my vows to the Lord*s in*ld the presence of all his people,
in*ln the courts of the house of the Lord,*s in*ld your midst, O Jerusalem. Praise*ln the Lord!*s
